intro: Sagenia gemmifera, commonly known as the gemmiferous sage, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Sagenia gemmifera is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. It is also noted for its ornamental value and is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
